Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] Move the Designer Targets to Xamarin.Android" (#2737) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
The Android Designer has a set of custom targets which it
uses to help prepare a project. This commit moves
them into the open source repository. The idea being that
we should be able to test the designer integration against
the open source repository rather than waiting for it to
be integrated into the consumer packages.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[tests] Create test results, when processing logcat output fails" (#2740) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
It is usually hard to notice the problem, when logcat processing fails
because of the logcat file missing. Thus it will make it easier to
find, when we create `TestResults` file with an error, similar to
`RenameTestCases` task.

Also added a conditional `Error` task after `RunInstrumentationTests`
and `RunUITests` tasks, to catch insufficiently specified
tests. Context: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/pull/2715

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[linux] Fix the build, by ignoring ntdll.dll dependency" (#2739) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Opened pull request "[Visual] Setup sandbox app" (#5264) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

This PR also adds a Sandbox project which greatly improves the development loop. It deploys to android in about 14 seconds vs the 40 seconds required for Control Gallery so it's much quicker to iterate with.

It's also a more friendly place for people to tinker with the source code

It's a more natural place for people to start when opening the Gallery and we can add some specific methods for helping people out. For example I added some simple methods for creating a stack layout page with safe padding.

People could also use this for logging issues. They can just paste the contents of the App.starthere.cs file into an issue instead of attaching a project

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "XF 3.5 Android Crashes Xamarin.Forms.Platform.Android.CellAdapter.OnItemClick" (#5263) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
ListViews Behaviours crash on android

### Description

### Steps to Reproduce

Add **Behaviours.Forms** nuget package https://github.com/davidbritch/behaviors

Respond to **Itemtapped** Event

```
		<ListView
				x:Name="ListView"
				AbsoluteLayout.LayoutFlags="XProportional,SizeProportional"
				AbsoluteLayout.LayoutBounds="0,45,1,1"
				android:ListView.IsFastScrollEnabled="True"
				ItemsSource="{ Binding Items }"
				CachingStrategy="RecycleElement"
				HasUnevenRows="True"
				RefreshCommand="{Binding RefreshCommand}"
				IsRefreshing="{Binding IsBusy}"
				IsPullToRefreshEnabled="true">
 

		 <ListView.Behaviors>
			 <behaviors:EventHandlerBehavior EventName="ItemTapped">
			
[error log.txt](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/2866939/error.log.txt)
[error log.txt](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/2866940/error.log.txt)

<behaviors:InvokeCommandAction Command="{Binding ItemTappedCommand}" />
			 </behaviors:EventHandlerBehavior>
		 </ListView.Behaviors>
```

### Expected Behavior
tapping in Android fires Command
### Actual Behavior
Android Crashes application - See Logs
### Basic Information

- Version with issue:
- Last known good version:
- IDE: VS2017
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
  - Android: 9
- Nuget Packages:
Behaviours.Forms

See attached Logs.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[macOS] NavigationRenderer internal stack reversed after RemovePage" (#5262) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Opened issue "[Visual] Activity Indicators aren't responding to height requests correctly" (#5261) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
```XAML
            <Label Text="Custom Background Color" Margin="0,0,0,-10" />
            <StackLayout Orientation="Horizontal">
                <ActivityIndicator HeightRequest="200"  BackgroundColor="{StaticResource SecondaryColor}" IsRunning="true" HorizontalOptions="FillAndExpand" />
                <ActivityIndicator HeightRequest="200"  BackgroundColor="{StaticResource SecondaryColor}" IsRunning="false" HorizontalOptions="FillAndExpand" />
            </StackLayout>

            <Label Text="Custom" Margin="0,0,0,-10" />
            <StackLayout Orientation="Horizontal">
                <ActivityIndicator HeightRequest="200"  Color="{StaticResource PrimaryColor}" BackgroundColor="{StaticResource SecondaryColor}" IsRunning="true" HorizontalOptions="FillAndExpand" />
                <ActivityIndicator HeightRequest="200"  Color="{StaticResource PrimaryColor}" BackgroundColor="{StaticResource SecondaryColor}" IsRunning="false" HorizontalOptions="FillAndExpand" />
            </StackLayout>
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "MSB4018: The "XamlCTask" task failed unexpectedly while upgrading Xam.forms 3.5.0.129452 " (#5260) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
Upgraded xam.forms 3.5.0.129452 on app. It is targeting .net standard 2.0.  But while compiling it gives me below error. (I double checked that all project have the same version of Xam.forms 3.5 and also remove bin/obj from all project, close solution and VS several times but it didn't make any impact.

```
Users/abc/.nuget/packages/xamarin.forms/3.5.0.129452/build/Xamarin.Forms.targets(107,3): error MSB4018: The "XamlCTask" task failed unexpectedly.
/Users/abc/.nuget/packages/xamarin.forms/3.5.0.129452/build/Xamarin.Forms.targets(107,3): error MSB4018: System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationException: Type 'XamlParseException' in Assembly 'Xamarin.Forms.Core, Version=2.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=798c2ba514f889d3' is not marked as serializable
/Users/abc/.nuget/packages/xamarin.forms/3.5.0.129452/build/Xamarin.Forms.targets(107,3): error MSB4018: 
/Users/abc/.nuget/packages/xamarin.forms/3.5.0.129452/build/Xamarin.Forms.targets(107,3): error MSB4018: 
/Users/abc/.nuget/packages/xamarin.forms/3.5.0.129452/build/Xamarin.Forms.targets(107,3): error MSB4018: Server stack trace: 
/Users/abc/.nuget/packages/xamarin.forms/3.5.0.129452/build/Xamarin.Forms.targets(107,3): error MSB4018: 
/Users/abc/.nuget/packages/xamarin.forms/3.5.0.129452/build/Xamarin.Forms.targets(107,3): error MSB4018: 
/Users/abc/.nuget/packages/xamarin.forms/3.5.0.129452/build/Xamarin.Forms.targets(107,3): error MSB4018: Exception rethrown at [0]: 
/Users/abc/.nuget/packages/xamarin.forms/3.5.0.129452/build/Xamarin.Forms.targets(107,3): error MSB4018:   at (wrapper xdomain-invoke) Xamarin.Forms.Build.Tasks.XamlTask.Execute()
/Users/abc/.nuget/packages/xamarin.forms/3.5.0.129452/build/Xamarin.Forms.targets(107,3): error MSB4018:   at Microsoft.Build.BackEnd.TaskExecutionHost.Microsoft.Build.BackEnd.ITaskExecutionHost.Execute () [0x00023] in /Users/builder/jenkins/workspace/build-package-osx-mono/2018-06/external/bockbuild/builds/msbuild-15/src/Build/BackEnd/TaskExecutionHost/TaskExecutionHost.cs:573 
/Users/abc/.nuget/packages/xamarin.forms/3.5.0.129452/build/Xamarin.Forms.targets(107,3): error MSB4018:   at Microsoft.Build.BackEnd.TaskBuilder.ExecuteInstantiatedTask (Microsoft.Build.BackEnd.ITaskExecutionHost taskExecutionHost, Microsoft.Build.BackEnd.Logging.TaskLoggingContext taskLoggingContext, Microsoft.Build.BackEnd.TaskHost taskHost, Microsoft.Build.BackEnd.ItemBucket bucket, Microsoft.Build.BackEnd.TaskExecutionMode howToExecuteTask) [0x001f6] in /Users/builder/jenkins/workspace/build-package-osx-mono/2018-06/external/bockbuild/builds/msbuild-15/src/Build/BackEnd/Components/RequestBuilder/TaskBuilder.cs:784 
```

### Steps to Reproduce

1. 
2. 
3. 

### Expected Behavior
It should compile
### Actual Behavior
It doesn't compile
### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.5.0.129452
- Last known good version: 3.4.0.1029999
- IDE:VS for Mac 7.7.3
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->

  - Android: 9.0<!-- The version of the Android SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 7.1 --> 
  - UWP:  N/A <!-- The version of the UWP SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 16299 -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[OpenGL] Fix MonoMacGameView .ctor when hardware acceleration isn't available" (#5614) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
- Fixes #4417: [XM] Add a `Create` method for the 'AppKit.NSOpenGLPixelFormat' type
  (https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/issues/4417)
- Doing `new MonoMacGameView (ContentView.Frame)` on CI fails because hardware acceleration isn't available.
  One of our samples had that code: https://github.com/xamarin/mac-samples/blob/a41f4387dc28617e4207b3759617e788aad383ed/MacOpenTK/MacOpenTK/MainWindow.cs#L40
  This made some QA sample tests fail.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[2018-10] mono-native-[compat|unified] fails on tvOS device: [FAIL] Introspection.CheckSymbols : dlsym() found mono_native_initialize() " (#5613) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Launch xharness, and run the `mono-native-compat/tvOS - device/Debug` test.

### Expected Behavior

Test passes.

### Actual Behavior

```
[FAIL] Introspection.CheckSymbols : dlsym() found mono_native_initialize() 
```

Complete test log: https://gist.github.com/rolfbjarne/193337daeda0bd1e452774dce2ba72b4

### Environment

PR #4904.

### Build Logs

https://gist.github.com/rolfbjarne/5708f34438de8f6fadf5a05b4e29b000
